page.title: 14The Farmer's Day in July
page.content: Get up at 5.30.Do all the morning feeding,40 calves at the farm and 150 in the fields.While up the fields I look at the crops as we have a problem with crows at this time of year.We need to call the vet because a 6 month heifer is coughing and a 4 month steer has a large lump on his hip.The vet can P.D.I. the milking cow.After breakfast I fetch the tractor from Mursley to blow the barn of hay we stacked in the rain as it has started to heat.Next a look at the fat cattle for market to- morrow.The Spray Rep. has arrived to walk the crops to check for pests.The crops look good.If the weather stays warm we will start next week so I spend the afternoon getting the combine ready.7.00 just sit down for supper when the phone rings:someone has left the gate open on the footpath. 30 steers are in Mr Little's herd.
